Skill.label: Chest - AW (swap out melee splash for bosses)

PathOfBuilding.Notes:
^2> HELP! WHERE IS THE LEVELING SECTION? <^7 You didn't watch the video and just copied the link from the Youtube description didn't you? This build requires United in Dream, so you can't really level with it. The Youtube description contains a link to a leveling build for this(using Summon Raging Spirits), so use that for leveling instead!
^2> PLAYSTYLE <^7 The playstyle for this build is a bit different and not for everyone.
When entering a map you cast bladefall and summon animate weapons from the blades on the ground. After that you Shield Charge around, convocating your weapons to you, and your weapons will kill everything, your weapons last 100 seconds. Make sure you keep Bone Offering up by casting it after a pack of monsters die, Bone Offering will last about 20 seconds. If your weapons die or expire you can resummon them using bladefall, or while clearing you can use your animate weapon skill randomly on the ground and hope you hit a weapon hidden by your lootfilter(you can still animate those!). On map bosses and tanky rares(3.19 rare buffs monkaS) you can use whitering step, divine blessing and/or despair(in that order of importance) if you feel like you lack damage.
For big bosses like Eater of Worlds you want to swap melee splash with the minion damage support, you can do this by having a white socket on your gear(use Vorici in Research for this). Playstyle wise you try to summon up to your weapon limit before engaging the boss. Cast Desecrate + Bone Offering + Divine Blessing(and keep these buffs up during the fight), then engage the boss. After engaging the boss spam Withering Step and try to keep Despair up on the boss. You can use Convocation to make your minions dodge boss abilities. Most bosses should die before your weapons run out, but in case they don't try to resummon some weapons with Bladefall while fighting the boss.
^2> FAQ <^7 ^xD02090What do I swap melee splash with on bosses?^7 You preferably swap melee splash with minion damage using a white socket. If you don't have a white socket you can use melee physical damage instead.
^xD02090Why not Unnatural Strength(Unholy Might ascendancy)?^7 Even on a build like this, even when switching all abyss jewels to physical damage instead of chaos damage, it just doesn't provide enough damage to be worth it.
^xD02090Wait, no vaal skill?^7 We already have to press a lot of buttons to bos on this, and there's big socket pressure. You can however put in Vaal Haste if you want, check out the "Can I fit an Animate Guardian into this build?" section to see how to free up sockets for it.
^xD02090My weapons are dying, how do I solve this?^7 If your weapons are dying a lot, first make sure they're elemental resist capped. Import your character into PoB, go to the "Calcs" tab, select Animate Weapon and tick "Show minion stats", now you can see their resists on the right side of your screen. Remember that this number includes the "Commander of Darkness" ascendancy node. So it only works if your weapons are in your aura radius, quality on your auras increases this radius! Using Bone Rings and resists on Ghastly Eye Jewels will help your weapons to cap their resists as well
The second thing to make sure is that you're keeping Bone Offering up, this caps out the block of your weapons and will help them survive.
Third thing to check is minion levels, they matter quite a bit for your weapon life, so try to get that +2 helmet mod and level 21 Animate Weapon soon!
If your weapons are still dying you could spec out of some of the nodes under Templar(Tireless and Sanctuary) and grab defensive minion nodes like Indomitable Army with the minion max res mastery.
^xD02090Can I fit an Animate Guardian into this build?^7 It's hard, since Bone Rings don't have sockets. Some strategies you could consider: - Give the guardian Despair on hit gloves, this frees up the socket we use for the Despair curse. - Replace a Bone Ring with an Unset Ring and put an aura or convocation in there, this frees up another socket. - Remove Spell Cascade from Desecrate/Bladefall(this will feel worse but is another socket)
If you free up 2 linked sockets somewhere you can link Animate Guardian to Minion Life and put items like Dying Breath and a white socket Crown of the Tyrant on there.
^xD02090Can I automate Desecrate + Bone Offering somehow?^7 Technically: kind of, but it requires a bit of sacrifice. You can craft the "trigger socketed spells while focussed" craft on your helmet. Now you can put your Desecrate and Bone Offering in your helmet and some skills that don't trigger like auras. Now you can press focus to trigger your Desecrate and Bone Offering every 12 seconds.
^xD02090My damage seems kinda low, how do I bring it up?^7 First of all check the "Playstyle" section of these notes to make sure you're playing the build correctly.
Abyss jewels are a pretty big part of the damage on this build, make sure you socket your highest damage jewels in your Darkness Enthroned. The most important roll on your abyss jewels is the "Minions deal 15-20% increased Damage if you've used a Minion Skill Recently" mod. This is always up due to convocation. The Covenant and Amanamu's Gaze are quite strong and should bring your damage up a lot as well, but they might be expensive. Awakened gems like Unbound Ailments, Multistrike and Minion Damage will help a lot as well.
^xD02090Why not Occultist?^7 While Occultist might seem like a logical choice(we're not even taking the Unholy Might node of Necromancer!), it will make both us and our minions die more often. Resummoning minions is really annoying and we want to do that as little as possible. Necromancer also provides us with 50% skill effect duration, making our Divine Blessing and weapons last much longer. You could use Forbidden Jewels to grab a node from the Occultist though: - Void Beacon: about 24% more damage and mobs regen less, great! - Withering Presence: automate wither and some decent chaos res, average node but it might be cheap. - Profane Bloom: probably really expensive, but good for clear. You'd have to fit in Blasphemy though, probably instead of Tempest Shield. Try to get mana reservation on your helmet(Eater and/or enchant) and maybe use an enlighten to fit it in.
^xD02090How do I use Bone Armour?^7 Ideally, if you're a god gamer, you press Bone Armour when you expect incoming damage. If you want to you can bind Bone Armour to left click though, maybe Ben_ will be mad at you if you do, but what he doesn't know can't hurt you ;)
^xD02090Cluster jewel?^7 A cluster jewel near Chaos Innoculation will provide you with some damage, but we'll have to give up some tankyness for it. Drop Tireless and Sanctity if you really want to fit one in, but it's not really worth it in my opinion so not included in this PoB.
^2> XIBAQUA? <^7 There's a "Endgame - Xibaqua" tree and gearset in this PoB. This will make you much tankier(especially against stuff with penetration like Shaper balls) but requires you to cap chaos res. The main difference in gear is that you want to get +3% max chaos resistance on your shield. I included a Glorious Vanity with +2% max chaos resistance to show what's possible to get, but there are multiple jewels in that position that can give this. Use the "Find timeless jewels" button at the bottom of the skilltree to find some seeds you can potentially buy.

Input.name: customMods
Input.string: 3.19 changes, remove when PoB gets updated to 3.19: Defiance Banner has 50% less aura effect Malevolence has 10% increased aura effect
